content.question: One morning, Lila was running late and was unable to find time to eat breakfast. She had planned to go on a five-mile hike before lunch that afternoon. However, only one mile into the hike, Lila turned back and went home early. Which of the following most likely explains the motivation for her behavior?

choices.label: Lila is hungry and is motivated by an internal drive to reduce her hunger by ending her hike early.
Lila is not intrinsically motivated by hiking and needs to begin again.
Lila is not motivated to meet her commitment without a peer joining her for the hike.
Lila has reduced her need for self-actualization by starting the hike and therefore does not need to finish it.

content.answer: Lila is hungry and is motivated by an internal drive to reduce her hunger by ending her hike early.
